#summary Step-by-step directions on obtaining OAuth keys from twitter
<a href="http://oauth.org/"><img src="http://img245.imageshack.us/img245/8438/200pxoauthlogosvg.png" align="right">
= OAuth is Required for Twitter Applications =

If you plan on using any of the twitter apps here on tailgate, you will need to create an OAuth keys.  These keys allow the app to perform actions on your behalf.  If you want to read the details, go to Twitter's API documentation.  If you just want to get up and running, follow these instructions.

  # *Go to http://dev.twitter.com/apps *.  If you are not logged in, you will be asked for your twitter credentials.  If you already have an app, you can use your existing keys.  
  # Click *[http://dev.twitter.com/apps/new Register a new app]*.
  # Fill out the form:
    * Type in a *name* for your app.  
    * *Description* can be left blank.
    * For the *application website*, please link to the appropriate wiki page on tailgate.  You don't have to, but it would be appreciated.
    * *Organization* can be left blank.
    * *Application Type* must be set to "client"
    * *Default Access Type* must be set to "read & write"
  # Click *Save*.
  # On the following page, you will be given the script Consumer OAuth Keys.  Copy and paste them into the script where appropriate.
  # Once complete, click *My Access Token* on the right side of the screen.
  # Copy your access tokens into the script where appropriate.
